page.title: 01LIVERPOOL CENTRAL (NORTH)
page.content: { This is the oldest part of Liverpool at present undergoing change and recovery from population drift and the loss of much traditional industry. { The famous Mersey skyline dominates the western dockyard frontage, now{ almost deserted where once it thrived. { Good road,rail & ferry communication based on a refurbished Lime St.station serve a pedestrianised city centre shopping area comprising all the national chain stores & market complex { Grouped together, the county museum, City Library and Walker Art Gallery both illustrate the architecture and house the treasures of the city. { If St George's Hall, the Bluecoat Chambers and the university building preserve our past,then the new houses, Royal hospital, Metropolitan cathedral and awareness of our tourist potential show confidence in our future.
